byline.contributor: Nick Corasaniti reported from Washington and Mike Isaac from San Francisco. Emmarie Huetteman contributed reporting from Washington.
byline.original: By NICK CORASANITI and MIKE ISAAC

abstract: Sen John Thune, chairman of Senate Commerce Committee, calls on Facebook to give explanation for report that its staff members intentionally filtered out news from conservative sources on so-called trending list.
lead_paragraph: John Thune, Republican chairman of the Senate Commerce Committee, wants a response to a report that Facebook suppressed conservative articles.

headline.main: Senator Demands Answers From Facebook on Claims of ‘Trending’ List Bias
headline.print_headline: Senator Demands Answers From Facebook on Claims of ‘Trending’ List Bias

snippet: John Thune, Republican chairman of the Senate Commerce Committee, wants a response to a report that Facebook suppressed conservative articles.
